title: The Sunless Sea
data:
- *For the similar branch in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), see [The Sea (dNetHack)](/wiki/The_Sea_\(dNetHack\) "The Sea (dNetHack)").*

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), **The Sunless Sea** is a single-level [dungeon branch](/wiki/Dungeon_branch "Dungeon branch") accessed by a [stairway](/wiki/Stair "Stair") down that is located between levels 28 and 31. Monster generation in the Sunless Sea is biased toward chaotic monsters.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Map](#Map)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Messages](#Messages)
- [4 See also](#See_also)
- [5 Reference](#Reference)

                              [}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")              [}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")

The ( on the island in the middle of the sea indicates a cache of treasure, composed of a chest, two random wands, two random amulets, two random rings, and three random gems; there are also four random objects located on the beach. There are five [giant crabs](/wiki/Giant_crab "Giant crab") on the beach. The marked monsters in the sea proper are all sharks; the sea also contains six other sharks and seven other random ;. The X mark indicates a burnt message reading "The lamp washed into the sea while I slept! Woe and damnation!" and a random item. As the engraving suggests, there is a magic lamp located somewhere in the sea.

## Strategy

After finding the lamp with a [potion of object detection](/wiki/Potion_of_object_detection "Potion of object detection") or blessed [scroll of magic mapping](/wiki/Scroll_of_magic_mapping "Scroll of magic mapping"), it can be moved to another location (hopefully land) with a zap from a wand of teleportation, or snatched with a [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip") while [levitating](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation"). Flying does not work for the bullwhip: [vampires](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)") need a levitation item. Swimming or [magical breathing](/wiki/Magical_breathing "Magical breathing") will also work. A carefully applied or zapped wand of cold can provide ice to dig the lamp out as well.

Another approach is to fill in the water using a scroll of earth and dig the lamp out with a pick-axe.

Retrieving the lamp is almost never worthwhile: for a character that can reach the Sunless Sea, a single wish isn't likely to make much of a difference. Moreover, SLASH'EM characters can [reverse genocide](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide") [gypsies](/wiki/Gypsies "Gypsies") to generate wishes if they need more. Ironically, the character most likely to find retrieving the lamp to be worth their time is a [wishless](/wiki/Wishless "Wishless") character who has not found an infinite light source yet: while the lighter [magic candle](/wiki/Magic_candle "Magic candle") is preferable, the lamp is better than nothing.

## Messages

- You hear the roar of the sea. That can't be right....

  You entered the level for the first time.

## See also

- [Special level (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Special_level_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Special level (SLASH'EM)")

## Reference

From file sea.des.

html:
The Sunless Sea

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the similar branch in dNetHack, see The Sea (dNetHack).

In SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM, and Hack'EM, The Sunless Sea is a single-level dungeon branch accessed by a stairway down that is located between levels 28 and 31. Monster generation in the Sunless Sea is biased toward chaotic monsters.

Contents

  • 1 Map
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Messages
  • 4 See also
  • 5 Reference

The X mark indicates a burnt message reading "The lamp washed into the sea while I slept! Woe and damnation!" and a random item. As the engraving suggests, there is a magic lamp located somewhere in the sea.

After finding the lamp with a potion of object detection or blessed scroll of magic mapping, it can be moved to another location (hopefully land) with a zap from a wand of teleportation, or snatched with a bullwhip while levitating. Flying does not work for the bullwhip: vampires need a levitation item. Swimming or magical breathing will also work. A carefully applied or zapped wand of cold can provide ice to dig the lamp out as well.

Another approach is to fill in the water using a scroll of earth and dig the lamp out with a pick-axe.
